column4: If anybody know why when I ssh to a unix server my enter, backspace and arrows dont work I would REALLY APRECCIATE IT
stty erase
are you using bash?
yeah
so what do i do?
You need to tell the server that the backspace key is a backspace key. You should add " stty erase '^?' " to your bash_rc
and what about for enter and the arrows
I added the line you told me to .bashrc and still didnt work :(
You'll need to login and out
oh wait a second
Sorry, I didn't explain properly, to enter stty erase '^?' . Without double quote marks ("). You need to type "stty erase ' " then type ctrl +c and then "?'"
if that makes sense?
not really :(
didnt make much sense at all sorry
You can also type stty erase (and then press backspace, and then return) in your terminal window and that should fix it for this session.
nah, stty is there by default.
http://www.acm.uiuc.edu/workshops/cool_unix/stty.html explains it well, if you look towards the bottom of the page
that's confusing, if you put it in your .bash_rc (note that starts with a .) then it should execute everytime you start a new session.
didnt work :(
Sorry, it's .bashrc, no underscore.
it didnt work :( I guess
If you're using putty and you go to to "keyboard" when you start it up and toggling the backspace key commands there doesn't work then I don't know why, sorry.
